snippet: A decades-long war over river flow into Apalachicola Bay in Florida has contributed to the collapse of the oyster industry there.
abstract: Georgia, Alabama and Florida's 23-year-long war over river flow into Apalachicola Bay in Florida has contributed to the collapse of the oyster industry there; diminished flow has other far-reaching consequences on bay's $6.6 million seafood industry; Congressional and state lawmakers are pushing for solution but odds of agreement between Georgia and Florida are not favorable.
lead_paragraph: A decades-long war over river flow into Apalachicola Bay in Florida has contributed to the collapse of the oyster industry there.

headline.seo: Thirst for Fresh Water Threatens Apalachicola Bay Fisheries
headline.main: A Fight Over Water, and to Save a Way of Life
headline.print_headline: A Fight Over Water, And to Save A Way of Life
